alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer; Loup (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 12 at 5:47PM CDT until October 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Custer County in central Nebraska... Southeastern Blaine County in north central Nebraska... Southwestern Loup County in north central Nebraska... * Until midnight CDT tonight. * At 547 PM CDT, Emergency management reports flash flooding in the vicinity of highway 21 and road 797. . Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring and expected to continue through midnight CDT. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Broken Bow, Lillian, Gates and Walworth. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
